ns1:Asset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - CM2012 - Prereqs Common
ns1:Asset.ns1:body:
# Load Common functions . .\Logging.ps1 . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1 . .\PlatformUtils.ps1 . .\UsersUtility.ps1
# get current script location $scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
ConfigureLogging $scriptPath $scriptName
######################################################################### # Main #########################################################################
#Use ArgList variable in Start-Process commands so embedded variables and env variables resolve #START.exe is used with msiexec otherwise it does not wait
$DomainFQDN = (get-globalvariable("Global\DomainFQDN")).value $DomainNetBIOS = (get-globalvariable("Global\DomainNetBIOS")).value $DomainDN = (get-globalvariable("AD\DistinguishedName")).value $ServiceAccountName = "$DomainNetBIOS\$CM_SERVICEACCOUNT" # Svc account not set as a local env variable yet so need to reference BluePrint variable $ServiceAccountPwd = get-serviceAccountPassword -username $CM_SERVICEACCOUNT.ToLower() # Covert to lowercase as get-serviceAccountPassword function is case sensitive $ADPermissionsDN = "OU=Permissions,OU=Administration,$DomainDN" $ADRolesDN = "OU=Roles,OU=Administration,$DomainDN"
If ($DomainFQDN -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $DomainFQDN not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($DomainNetBIOS -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $DomainNetBIOS not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($DomainDN -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $DomainDN not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($ServiceAccountName -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $ServiceAccountName not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($ServiceAccountPwd -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $ServiceAccountPwd not defined'; EXIT 1}
Log "**** Starting: Common Pre-Reqs Config... ****" Log "`n"
Log "Copy required content locally..." # Will be copied to C:\Users\<profile> Get-AppFiles "PC Devices\System Center\Server Provisioning\Common" Get-AppFiles "PC Devices\Misc\Microsoft .NET" Get-AppFiles "PC Devices\Misc\Windows Features" Log "`n"
Log "Set Common Environment Variables..." SETX CM_ServiceAccount $CM_SERVICEACCOUNT /M Log "`n"
Log "Set Timezone..." tzutil /s "$OS_TIMEZONE" If ($LastExitCode -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: Timezone could not be set. Possibly due to inability to enumerate variables."; EXIT 1} Log "`n"
Log "Copy CMTrace.exe... " If (!(Test-Path "$env:ProgramFiles\CMTrace")) {MD "$env:ProgramFiles\CMTrace"} Copy-Item "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\CMTrace\CMTrace.exe" "$env:ProgramFiles\CMTrace\" -Force Log "`n"
Log "Defining Windows Firewall Ports..." Start-Process -NoNewWindow -Wait "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Scripts\Windows Firewall\CM2012-Windows Firewall.cmd" Log "`n"
# Install Windows Roles and Features. Note: Any Get-AppFiles commands after this point have failed, presumably due to a reboot required that is changing behaviour. Log "Installing Windows 2012 Roles (.NET 3.5 - includes .NET 2.0 and 3.0)..." # .NET 4.0 is already included in the Server SOE Log " **KB2966828 | .NET 3.5 prereq on Win2012 as per KB3005628" CMD /c Start /WAIT WUSA.exe "$ScriptPath\WindowsFeatures_Prereq\Windows8.1-KB2966828-x64.msu" /quiet /norestart /log:"$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-KB3005628.log" Log " **.NET 3.5" Install-WindowsFeature -Name NET-Framework-Core -Source "$ScriptPath\WindowsFeatures_Prereq\sxs" -LogPath "$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-Roles_.NET3.5.log" # Source switch used for .NET 3.5 only Log "`n"
Log "Installing Windows 2012 Roles (IIS)..." Install-WindowsFeature -Name Web-Default-Doc,Web-Dir-Browsing,Web-Http-Errors,Web-Static-Content,Web-Http-Redirect,Web-Health,Web-Performance,Web-Filtering,Web-Basic-Auth,Web-IP-Security,Web-Url-Auth,Web-Windows-Auth,Web-Net-Ext,Web-Net-Ext45,Web-ASP,Web-ASP-Net,Web-ASP-Net45,Web-ISAPI-Ext,Web-ISAPI-Filter,Web-Mgmt-Console,Web-Metabase,Web-Lgcy-Scripting,Web-WMI,Web-Scripting-Tools,Web-Mgmt-Service -LogPath "$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-Roles_IIS.log" Log "`n"
Log "Installing Windows 2012 Roles (WDS)..." Install-WindowsFeature -Name WDS -LogPath "$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-Roles_WDS.log" Log "`n"
Log "Installing Windows 2012 Features (BITS, BranchCache, GPMC, RDC, AD Psh Modules, AD Tools, Share & Storage Mgt, File Resource Mgr)..." Install-WindowsFeature -Name BITS-IIS-Ext,RSAT-Bits-Server,BranchCache,GPMC,RDC,RSAT-AD-PowerShell,RSAT-ADDS-Tools,RSAT-ADLDS,RSAT-CoreFile-Mgmt,FS-Resource-Manager -LogPath "$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-Features.log" Log "`n" Start-Sleep -Seconds 30
Log "Installing .NET 4.5.2..." $ArgList = "/q /norestart /log `"$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-.NET4.5.2.log`"" Start-Process -NoNewWindow -Wait -FilePath "$ScriptPath\Microsoft .NET 4.5.2\NDP452-KB2901907-x86-x64-AllOS-ENU.exe" -ArgumentList $arglist Log "`n"
Log "Define local admins..." # Does not require domain credentials to run # Note: svc account needs to be local admin prior to calling any LaunchProcessAsUser function, as it needs logon as a batch job rights AddUserToLocalAdministrators -ServerName "$env:Computername" -UserName "$ServiceAccountName" If (!(net LocalGroup Administrators | Select-String -Pattern $CM_SERVICEACCOUNT)) {"ERROR: $ServiceAccountName could not be added to local admins"; EXIT 1} # Validate local admin
net user /add PCDevices_Admin pcd@dmin01 # Create local account AddUserToLocalAdministrators -ServerName "$env:Computername" -UserName "$env:Computername\PCDevices_Admin" Log "`n"
If ($env:CM_SITECODE) # If Primary server is being stood up, then create AD objects. Needs to be done in this script as it's a prereq to subsequent AD group membership tasks { Log "Current server is detected as a Primary server..." Log " ** Copy required Primary content locally..." # Will be copied to C:\Users\<profile> Get-AppFiles "PC Devices\System Center\Server Provisioning\Primary"
Log " ** Creating AD Objects" # Modify PS1 file $PS1File = "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Scripts\CM2012-AD Object-Creation.ps1" (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "DomainNetBIOS =.*" , "DomainNetBIOS = `"$DomainNetBIOS`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "DomainDN =.*" , "DomainDN = `"$DomainDN`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "ADPermissionsDN =.*" , "ADPermissionsDN = `"$ADPermissionsDN`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "ADRolesDN =.*" , "ADRolesDN = `"$ADRolesDN`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File
# Run PS1 file using svc account credentials $ArgList = "/c Powershell -file `"$PS1File`"" $ret = LaunchProcessAsUser "$env:ComSpec" $ArgList $ServiceAccountName $ServiceAccountPwd # Needs to run %COMSPEC% as Powershell.exe was not found and is looking for absolute path If ($ret -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: AD object creation failed"; EXIT 1} Log "`n"
} Else { Log "Current server is NOT detected as a Primary server. Assuming AD accounts and groups have already been created. Continuing..." Log "`n" }
Log "Define AD group membership..." $PS1File = "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Scripts\CM2012-AD Group-Membership.ps1" # Define AD group membership prereqs. Needs to run under svc account (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "DomainNetBIOS =.*" , "DomainNetBIOS = `"$DomainNetBIOS`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "ADRolesDN =.*" , "ADRolesDN = `"$ADRolesDN`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File $ArgList = "/c Powershell -file `"$PS1File`"" $ret = LaunchProcessAsUser "$env:ComSpec" $ArgList $ServiceAccountName $ServiceAccountPwd # Needs to run %COMSPEC% as Powershell.exe was not found and is looking for absolute path If ($ret -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: AD group membership failed"; EXIT 1} Log "`n"
Log "Define Additional Local Admins..." # Does not require domain credentials to run AddUserToLocalAdministrators -ServerName "$env:Computername" -UserName "$DomainNetBIOS\ROLE-SCCM-Servers" If (!(net LocalGroup Administrators | Select-String -Pattern ROLE-SCCM-Servers)) {"ERROR: ROLE-SCCM-Servers could not be added to local admins"; EXIT 1} # Validate local admin
AddUserToLocalAdministrators -ServerName "$env:Computername" -UserName "$DomainNetBIOS\DEL-G-CSC Infrastructure Services" Log "`n"
Log "Defining Drive Letters that ConfigMgr can use..." $disks = gwmi win32_logicaldisk -Filter "DriveType='3'" ForEach ($id in $disks.DeviceID) { If ($id -ne "F:") {New-Item $id\NO_SMS_ON_DRIVE.sms -Type file -Force} } Log "`n"
Log "Creating IIS Cleanup Task..." Start-Process -NoNewWindow -Wait "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Scripts\IIS 8.5\IIS Logs-Cleanup-SchTask.cmd" Log "`n"
Log "Creating User Profile Cleanup Task..." $SchTasks_Date = (Get-Date).AddDays(5).ToString("MM/dd/yyyy") $ProfPath = $env:UserProfile # Create Agility User cleanup script echo "Get-CimInstance win32_userprofile -Verbose | Where {`$_.LocalPath -eq '$ProfPath'} | Remove-CimInstance -Verbose" > $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\Agility-DelProf.ps1 SchTasks /Create /SC "Once" /SD $SchTasks_Date /ST 01:00 /F /RU "SYSTEM" /TN "Agility-DelProf" /TR "Powershell.exe -File '$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\Agility-DelProf.ps1'" Log "`n"
Log "**** Finished: Common Pre-Reqs Config... ****"

ns1:variable.ns1:name: CM_SERVICEACCOUNT
ns1:variable.ns1:description: Service Account used to install ConfigMgr
